Independent Order of Odd Fellows Council 837 minute book
Independent Order of Odd Fellows Council 837 minute book

The Independent Order of Odd Fellows (IOOF) was an international fraternal organization founded in Baltimore, MD in 1819 and became the first fraternal organization open to both men and women in 1851. This collection contains the handwritten minutes of meetings of the IOOF Council 837 of Brooklyn, N.Y. from 1855 (when it was founded) to 1856 compiled by Secretary Cornelius Stryker.

The Independent Order of Odd Fellows (IOOF) was an international fraternal organization founded in Baltimore, MD in 1819 and became the first fraternal organization open to both men and women in 1851. This collection contains the handwritten minutes of meetings of the IOOF Council 837 of Brooklyn, N.Y. from 1855 (when it was founded) to 1856 compiled by Secretary Cornelius Stryker.

Stryker, Cornelius

One bound book containing handwritten minutes of meetings of the IOOF Council 837 of Brooklyn, N.Y. from 1855 to 1856. Minutes detail business discussed, members present, nominations of new members, and initiations. The first page contains a list of officers and committee members. The minutes were compiled by Secretary Cornelius Stryker.

The Independent Order of Odd Fellows (IOOF) was an international fraternal organization founded in Baltimore, MD in 1819. It became the first fraternal organization open to both men and women in 1851. The IOOF Council 837 of Brooklyn, N.Y. was formed in 1855.
Gift of Mrs. Wheeler N. Voorhees, date unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.
